description: Odd numbers interspersed with double the previous odd number.
comments: As pointed out by E. Angelini on the SeqFan list (cf. link), this is the lexicographically earliest sequence of positive integers without repetitions such that the sum of four consecutive terms is always a multiple of 4. - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 22 2013
links: E. Angelini, k-chunks sum and division by k, post to the SeqFan list, Mar 22 2013
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,0,-1).
example: a(1)=1 because n is odd. a(2)=2 because a(1)*2=2.
mathematica: Flatten[Table[Accumulate[{2 n - 1, 2 n - 1}], {n, 40}]] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Nov 22 2015 *)
author: Jim Cook (jcook(AT)halcyon.com), Mar 01 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Mar 01 2000
